title: Taking an argument hides lifetime error

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This compiles without error:

```rust
fn foo(s: &i32) -> &i32 {
    &0
}

```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=1e1dbb37bfe82aa69cd3314c588c240d))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
warning: unused variable: `s`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:8
  |
1 | fn foo(s: &i32) -> &i32 {
  |        ^ help: if this is intentional, prefix it with an underscore: `_s`
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_variables)]` on by default

warning: function is never used: `foo`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:4
  |
1 | fn foo(s: &i32) -> &i32 {
  |    ^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default

warning: 2 warnings emitted

    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.73s

```

---

But this errors, even though there shouldn't be a difference as `s` is not used in the previous example:

```rust
fn foo() -> &i32 {
    &0
}

```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=2e4b4b786425c4fe1108bf655d78cbef))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0106]: missing lifetime specifier
 --> src/lib.rs:1:13
  |
1 | fn foo() -> &i32 {
  |             ^ expected named lifetime parameter
  |
  = help: this function's return type contains a borrowed value, but there is no value for it to be borrowed from
help: consider using the `'static` lifetime
  |
1 | fn foo() -> &'static i32 {
  |             ^^^^^^^^

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0106`.
error: could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```

---

Potentially related to #77910.
